body_html:
@peterjc123

When I install your pytorch v0.21 package for win64 and python3.6,
activate.bat and deactivate.bat or other files are changed and they are dependent on your environment.
For example the acitvate.bat is as follows:

@echo off
call "C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\activate" %*

I am using miniconda3 then, activate/deactivate commands don't work.
I don't think that is a critical problem. I just report the above for your imformation.

body:
@peterjc123  

When I install your pytorch v0.21  package for win64 and python3.6, 
activate.bat and deactivate.bat or other files are changed and they are dependent on your environment.
For example the acitvate.bat is as follows: 
```
@echo off
call "C:\Anaconda2\Scripts\activate" %*
```
I am using miniconda3  then, activate/deactivate commands don't work. 
I don't think that is a critical problem.  I just report the above for your imformation.
